text: Hi, I’m Francis,
the host of this show "Cooking with Dog."
First, let’s make the syrup.
Combine the sugar and matcha green tea powder.
And stir to mix.
Then, pour in the hot water
and dissolve the sugar completely.
Let it sit to cool and then chill the syrup in the fridge.
Shaving a large block of ice is easier than small one
so use a deep freezable container to make the ice.
Wear a kitchen glove to hold the ice firmly
and shave it with a knife.
Avoid using an expensive knife
since the blade might be damaged.
And never use a ceramic knife for this purpose
otherwise it will snap.
Gradually rotate the ice
so that you can easily shave off the ice.
Be careful not to cut yourself.
If you are not sure about your knife skills,
do not try this method
and please use a shaved ice maker.
Now, turn the ice over.
Then, continue shaving.
Alright, Chef is getting tired
so let’s make the Uji Milk Kintoki.
Chill a bowl beforehand
and place the sweet azuki bean paste in it.
Cover it with some shaved ice.
Then, pour over the matcha syrup.
Arrange the shaved ice as tall as you can.
Pour the syrup over again.
Drizzle on the sweetened condensed milk.
Finally, add more sweet bean paste.
Ta-da!
Uji is associated with a high-grade tea brand Uji-tea in Kyoto
and Kintoki is another name for anko, sweet bean paste.
If you are interested in making sweet bean paste,
please check out our ogura butter sandwich video.
Good luck in the kitchen!
